meanings.definition: A group of people who travel together in a van, typically to and from work.
meanings.sent1: The vanpools arrived at the office early every morning.
meanings.sent2: We joined a vanpool to save money on our commute.
meanings.sent3: The vanpools joked and chatted on their way to work.
meanings.sent4: The vanpools were like a mobile coffee break during the commute.
meanings.sent5: The vanpools made the daily drive more enjoyable for everyone.

meanings.sent1: We vanpools to work to reduce our carbon footprint.
meanings.sent2: She vanpools with her coworkers to share gas expenses.
meanings.sent3: They vanpools together, singing along to the radio.
meanings.sent4: He vanpools daily, enjoying the company of his fellow passengers.
meanings.sent5: Vanpooling is a great way to save money on transportation.

meanings.definition: The act of sharing a van for transportation.
meanings.sent1: The vanpool was a convenient way for employees to commute.
meanings.sent2: Sharing a vanpool helped reduce traffic congestion.
meanings.sent3: The vanpool arrangement made carpooling more efficient.
meanings.sent4: The vanpool system improved the daily commute for many.
meanings.sent5: Joining a vanpool can make your commute more enjoyable.
